    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseLight

        public BaseLight(Vector3f colour,
                 float intensity)
        As there isn't a convenience class of yet, Vector3f is used in order to determine the colour of the light. Whilst Vector3f has parameters Vector3f(float x, float y, float z), the values are represented for the.

        BaseLight's colour like so: Colour(RBG) float x = R float y = G float z = B

        Example: BaseLight(new Vector3f(1, 1, 1), 1.0f) Returns a BaseLight that is white with an intensity of 1.0f

        BaseLight(new Vector3f(1, 0, 0), 0.5f) Returns a BaseLight that is red with an intensity of 0.5f

        Parameters:
        colour - The desired colour for the Base Light(RPG).
        intensity - The intensity of the light.

    • Method Detail

      • addToEngine

        public void addToEngine(CoreEngine engine)
        Convenience method that is overidden from it's parent class. Allows us to easily add a BaseLight to our engine list of lights.
        Overrides:
        addToEngine in class GameComponent
        Parameters:
        engine - The Core Engine in order to add the light(Not Rendering Engine!).

      • getIntensity

        public float getIntensity()
        Returns:
        The intensity of the Base Light.

      • setIntensity

        public void setIntensity(float intensity)
        Recommended to keep between greater than 0.0f and smaller than 1.0f to avoid any weird behavior. However putting it higher should not actually cause any harm. Set it above 1.0f only if you really need to.
        Parameters:
        intensity - The intensity of the Base Light.

      • getColour

        public Vector3f getColour()
        Returns:
        The colour of the Base Light(RGB).

      • setColour

        public void setColour(Vector3f colour)
        As there isn't a convenience class of yet, Vector3f is used in order to determine the colour of the light. Whilst Vector3f has parameters Vector3f(float x, float y, float z), the values are represented for the

        BaseLight's colour like so: Colour(RBG) float x = R float y = G float z = B

        Example: BaseLight(new Vector3f(1, 1, 1), 1.0f) Returns a BaseLight that is white with an intensity of 1.0f

        BaseLight(new Vector3f(1, 0, 0), 0.5f) Returns a BaseLight that is red with an intensity of 0.5f

        Parameters:
        colour - The desired colour for the Base Light(RPG).

      • setShader

        public void setShader(Shader shader)
        Parameters:
        shader - Set's the Base Light's shader.

      • getShader

        public Shader getShader()
        Returns:
        The Base Light's shader.
